main_definition: Relating to the actual doing or use of something, as opposed to thinking or talking about it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Realistic and sensible; concerned with actual problems rather than theories or ideas: a practical approach
meanings_and_examples.example: She took a practical approach to solving the problem by implementing a tried-and-tested solution.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to the world of daily life as opposed to theory or intellect; concerned with facts, realities and actual problems: a practical attitude
meanings_and_examples.example: Having a practical attitude means focusing on what needs to be done in reality rather than getting lost in abstract ideas.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Of use; advantageous in some way or another.
meanings_and_examples.example: The tool was very practical for completing the task at hand.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to things that are useful, rather than theoretical: a pragmatic approach
meanings_and_examples.example: She adopted a practical and pragmatic approach when dealing with complex issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Capable of being carried out or put into effect; feasible.
meanings_and_examples.example: The plan was very practical, as it could be easily implemented within the given time frame.
